sentences.sContent: As a very small child she had learned to mistrust adults.
sentences.sCn: 她很小的时候就学会了不相信大人。

remMethod.val: mis (错误， 坏) + trust (相信) → 不相信， 猜疑

words.tran: 不信任的；深疑的，多疑的

trans.tranOther: to not trust someone, especially because you think they may treat you unfairly or dishonestly
the feeling that you cannot trust someone, especially because you think they may treat you unfairly or dishonestly
